intro: Junellia tridactyla, commonly known as the three-toed junellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Junellia tridactyla typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
